references.reason: This paper introduces neural ordinary differential equations (NODEs), a novel approach to modeling dynamical systems that provides a powerful framework for optimizing stochastic differential equations (SDEs).
This book provides a comprehensive overview of partial differential equations (PDEs), which are fundamental to the theoretical foundation of the generator gradient estimator used for optimizing SDEs.

references.paper_title: Likelihood ratio gradient estimation for stochastic systems
references.reason: This paper presents a foundational work on likelihood ratio gradient estimation, a key technique for computing gradients of expectations involving stochastic processes, which is crucial for optimizing SDEs.
This book provides a comprehensive mathematical framework for stochastic flows and jump diffusions, which is fundamental to the analysis of the pathwise derivative and generator gradient estimators.

references.paper_title: Applied Stochastic Control of Jump Diffusions
references.reason: This book offers a detailed treatment of applied stochastic control of jump diffusions, providing valuable context for understanding and optimizing the SDE models discussed in the paper.
